subject: Re: [junit] Can't add an object to a TestSuite?
msgSnippet: ... Yes. The fix is included below. ... +         TestRunner.run(FooTest.suite()); ... -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
natemc47 wrote:

> Hello,
>
> I thought the code below would work, but it doesn't. Is there a way to do
> something along these lines, or am I barking up the wrong tree?

Yes. The fix is included below.
>
> Thanks!
> Nate
>
> P.S. The error I get is
> [nate@crunchy foo]$ java -cp foo.jar:junit.jar FooTest
> .F
> Time: 0.022
> There was 1 failure:
> 1) null(FooTest)junit.framework.AssertionFailedError
> at FooTest.main(FooTest.java:12)
>
>
>
> import junit.framework.Test;
> import junit.framework.TestCase;
> import junit.framework.TestSuite;
> import junit.textui.TestRunner;
>
> public class FooTest extends TestCase {
> public static void main(final String[] args) {
> TestRunner.run(new FooTest());

+ TestRunner.run(FooTest.suite());

> }
>
> public static Test suite() {
> final TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
> suite.addTest(new BarTest(5));
> return suite;
> }
>
> public static final class BarTest extends TestCase {
> public BarTest(final int x) { this.x = x; }
> public void testBar() { System.out.println(x); }
> private final int x;
> }
> }
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
